site.title: Bart & Nathalia's Wedding
site.description: Join us for our special day on June 14, 2025 in Semarang, Indonesia

hero.invitation: We're getting married and we'd love for you to join us on our special day

bart.description: Bart grew up in Amsterdam and moved to Semarang in 2020 where he works as a digital nomad. He loves exploring the city, and immersing himself in the local Javanese culture.

nathalia.description: Nathalia was born and raised in Semarang. She works in hospitality in her hometown. She enjoys cooking traditional Javanese dishes and sharing her cultural heritage.

ceremony.title: Traditional Javanese Ceremony
ceremony.description: Join us for a traditional Javanese wedding ceremony that honors both of our cultural backgrounds.

reception.title: Reception
reception.description: Celebrate with us at our beachfront reception featuring a blend of Indonesian and Dutch cuisines, live music, and dancing under the stars.

travel.title: Travel & Accommodation
travel.intro: We're excited to welcome you to Semarang, Indonesia for our wedding celebration. Below you'll find information to help you plan your trip and make your stay comfortable.

byAir.title: By Air
byAir.description: The closest airport is Ahmad Yani International Airport (SRG) in Semarang. For international travelers, you may need to connect through Jakarta (CGK) or Bali (DPS) airports.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The local currency is Indonesian Rupiah (IDR). ATMs are widely available, and major credit cards are accepted at hotels and larger establishments. It's good to have some cash for smaller vendors and transportation.

language.title: Language
language.description: Bahasa Indonesia is the official language, with Javanese being widely spoken in Semarang. English is spoken in tourist areas and major hotels. We'll provide a small phrasebook in your welcome package.
